title: Fried Rice with Cilantro and Peas
ingredients: 1 cup fresh cilantro, picked over and chopped
4 green onions, thinly sliced into small segments
1 tablespoon soy sauce (preferable the Kikkoman brand)
instructions: Pick over the fresh cilantro to remove leafs or stems that have passed their prime and chop it finely.  Cut off the tips of the green onions and remove the outer layers.  Leaving several inches of the green stems slice the green onions thinly into small pieces.  In a large nonstick skillet cook the cumin seeds in the oil over moderately high heat, stirring, until fragrant, about one minute.  Add the rice and fry, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 3 minutes.  Add the vinegar and soy sauce, stirring to coat the rice, and stir-fry until the liquid is evaporated.  Stir in the cilantro, green onions, and the peas and continue stir-frying until everything is heated through, about 2 minutes.
Season with salt, if desired, and serve.
Source:  The Best of Gourmet 2000, from the Editors of Gourmet, ©1999 by The Condé Nast Publications, Published by Random House Inc., New York.
